pros: Everything was good at this place

job_title: Academic Advisor in New Haven, CT
pros: The students are diverse and great! Location a unbeatable. Professional autonomy.
cons: GCC was without leadership for a significant amount of time and it shows. The CT community colleges are undergoing a consolidation and fear and resistance are running high. Things will be interesting here as they make way towards Fall 2023x when they’re “one college “

review_title: Director of Business and Industry Services
job_title: Director of Business and Industry Services in New Haven, CT
pros: Great opportunity to change people lives by providing them with the skills they need to support their Families and others in the community.
cons:
There are really no "Cons" , Those who wish to work at GCC should be prepared to be flexible
and have the desire to work closely with people from all walks of life.
This may require; extra hours,  empathy  and patience.

job_title: Education Assistant in New Haven, CT
pros:
Staff is mission driven and caring
Great place to grow and learn
Students are respectful
Things are changing in the right direction
cons:
Salary is very low but to be expected since it is a state job
Politics at the upper levels
Enforce policies that are ineffective and no efficient
Emotionally draining, you are more than just a teacher or staff worker

job_title: Media Specialist in New Haven, CT
pros: Diverse teams, interacting with very many different walks of life, and some of the professors are real experts in their field
cons: Finances hinder a lot of what can be realistically done or improved upon for the student experience, and there is no cohesive direction or mission statement. Every department is relatively siloed.

review_title: It's a fast-paced customer service based organization.
cons: Scheduling is around events, sometimes conflicting with time needed off
